intro: Sedum salazarii, commonly known as the Salazarii stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It features fleshy, upright stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has thick, water-storing leaves that help it survive in arid conditions. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a valuable addition to xeriscapes and container gardens.
